content:
hi @WG-prioritization I've discussed and had approval from the T-compiler to upload and store on a git repository all the past meetings agenda.
Here is the relevant PR:
https://github.com/rust-lang/compiler-team/pull/463

The reason is that HackMD is a great viewing tool and good enough for collaborative editing, but as the tool to prepare the whole agenda (i.e. frequent small updates pushed to their servers) is just not good enough.

I've stopped using a while ago it in favor of an offline approach and then upload the final agenda just once to HackMD for the team to see during the meeting.
So just a FIY that I will update the prioritization agenda procedure to also include this new git part
